The ground in a 10-foot radius around the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is doughlike difficult terrain.

Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

The ground in a 10-foot radius around the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is doughlike difficult terrain. Make a Strength saving throw.
Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] exhales acid in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide.

Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] exhales acid in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] spits acid in a line that is 30 ft. long and 5 ft. wide, provided that it has no creature grappled.

Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] spits acid in a line that is 30 ft. long and 5 ft. wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is also grappled by it escape DC 13. Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is also grappled by it. Make an escape check, with disadvantage.
As a bonus action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.
The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
In the first round of a combat, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s weapon attacks are magical. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s weapon attacks are magical. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits with any weapon, the weapon deals extra radiant damage (included in the attack).

Up to four chains the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] can see within 60 feet of it magically sprout razor-edged barbs and animate under the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]]'s control, provided that the chains aren't being worn or carried.

Each animated chain is an object with AC 20, 20 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage. When the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] uses Multiattack on its turn, it can use each animated chain to make one additional chain attack. An animated chain can grapple one creature of its own but can't make attacks while grappling. An animated chain reverts to its inanimate state if reduced to 0 hit points or if the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] is incapacitated or dies.

Up to four chains the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] can see within 60 feet of it magically sprout razor-edged barbs and animate under the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]]'s control, provided that the chains aren't being worn or carried.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a [[lookup @name lowercase]], except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option.

An animated tree acts as an ally of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it.

If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s touch.If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] corrodes a ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field.

If targeted by dispel magic, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field.

During its first turn, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the [[lookup @name lowercase]] scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on some rolls.
At the start of each of its turns, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] deals 5 (1d10) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks the nearest creature it can see.

If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks with its Bite.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] utters a blasphemous word. Each non-[[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] creature within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] utters a blasphemous word. Each non-[[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] creature within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can hear the magical utterance must make a Constitution saving throw.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales a 15-foot cone of blinding dust.

Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales a 15-foot cone of blinding dust. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Each creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Each creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a Constitution saving throw.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until magic such as the lesser restoration spell removes the blindness.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact.

Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must make a Dexterity saving throw.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't use its blindsight while deafened and unable to smell.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to travel to it, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the distance and direction to the amulet.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is magically bound to an amulet.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being Frightened.

(NOTE: THIS SHOULD BE USED ONLY IF THE CREATURE HAS MORE THAN ONE TYPE OF BREATH WEAPON, AND CONTAINS THE CHARGES FOR THOSE BREATH WEAPONS. EACH BREATH WEAPON ITSELF SHOULD ALSO BE ADDED.)


The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] uses one of the following breath weapons.

**Fire Breath.** The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] exhales fire in an 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (13d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

**Sleep Breath.** The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] exhales sleep gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] breathes in!
A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits with it (included in the attack).
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]]'s choice).

In a new form, the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) slashing damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes extra slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

One humanoid the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of it must make a Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s verbal or telepathic commands.

If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Charm for the next 24 hours. the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

One humanoid the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet of it must make a Wisdom saving throw.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically calls 2d4 swarms of bats or rats, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can call 3d6 wolves instead.

The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dismisses them as a bonus action.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically calls swarms of bats or rats. While outdoors, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can call wolves instead.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one claw attack.

**Cold Breath.** The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, taking 58 (13d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding it.

As a bonus action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can target one creature it can see within 5 ft. of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive.

The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can target one creature it can see within 5 ft. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw.

Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls.

If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] is destroyed after dealing damage. The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] corrodes metal.

A creature that touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] corrodes.

After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed after dealing damage. the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

A creature that touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently.

The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control. the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space.

A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the [[lookup @name lowercase]] maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell).

Any creature but the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained by it. the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] loses sight of it.

A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 120 feet of it. A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.
On each of its turns, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use a bonus action to take the dash, disengage, or hide action.
While attached to a creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down) and that creature takes the other half.

A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the [[lookup @name lowercase]] maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell).

Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], moves with it, and spreads around corners. Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures.

Each of those creatures must succeed on a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked prone and take 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked prone, and is pushed 5 ft. out of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked prone.

When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it explodes in a burst of dust. Each creature within 5 ft. of it must then succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it explodes in a burst of dust. Each creature within 5 ft. of it must make a Constitution saving throw.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 ft. of her. If the target can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it must make a Wisdom saving throw against this magic.

When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s weapons.

When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s weapons.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

Each non-[[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] creature within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a Constitution saving throw against this magic.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows if it hears a lie.

As a bonus action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit.

This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

As a bonus action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra radiant damage to a target on a hit.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

The target must make a Constitution saving throw against this magic.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one creature it can see within 60 ft. of it. If the target can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one creature it can see within 60 ft. of it. If the target can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it must make a Wisdom saving throw against this magic.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

The [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the [[lookup @details.type.config.label lowercase]] doesn't disturb the material it moves through.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't use its blindsight while deafened.
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only equipment the [[lookup @name lowercase]] was wearing or carrying.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters a creature's space, the creature must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw.On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is restrained, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC 12 Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters a creature's space, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

For 1 minute, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. of it. The charmed target is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control and can't take reactions, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. Whenever the target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't wear or carry anything.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.
the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

Any creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions. 1 use per day.

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed.

The charmed creature regards the [[lookup @name lowercase]] as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected.
